definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible

sentences.english: At this point of time, Hanwen arrives to arrest Shouye.
sentences.chinese: 这时汉文与伟民前来拘捕守业，众人吃惊。

sentences.english: They were arrested for brawling in the street.
sentences.chinese: 他们因在街上打斗而遭到拘捕。

sentences.english: Only the Pre-Trial Chamber has the authority to issue arrest warrants or summonses.
sentences.chinese: 只有预审庭有权力发布拘捕证或传票。

sentences.english: He was arrested since he had violate forged crime.
sentences.chinese: 他因犯伪造罪而被拘捕。

sentences.english: He was arrested on a charge of having infringed the Election Law.
sentences.chinese: 他因被指控触犯选举法而被拘捕。

sentences.english: Instead, Rabe was arrested by the Gestapo.
sentences.chinese: 不料盖世太保反而把拉伯拘捕。

sentences.english: They were busted and put away on narcotics charges.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控吸致幻毒品而被拘捕和被关进监狱。

sentences.english: The authorities arrested the main agitator of the movement.
sentences.chinese: 当局拘捕了运动的主要煽动者。

sentences.english: There's a warrant out for him.
The police arrested one principal criminal and two accomplices.
sentences.chinese: 警方一举拘捕了一名主犯和两名同案犯。

sentences.english: The police probe into organized crime led to several arrests.
sentences.chinese: 警方对有组织犯罪的调查使数人受到拘捕。

sentences.english: They were arrested, and so was Bibi Aisha.
sentences.chinese: 他们被拘捕，并因此获得比比阿伊莎。

sentences.english: By virtue of his authority as consul, he had the man arrested.
sentences.chinese: 他凭著领事的权力拘捕了这个人。
法希太需要拘捕这个家伙了。

sentences.english: A total of 912 persons were arrested for drug-related offences.
sentences.chinese: 总共有912人因毒品罪行而被拘捕。

sentences.english: The entire process has been she filmed, huai for arrest will also.
sentences.chinese: 原来整个过程已被雅晴拍摄下来，还淮备拘捕志坚。

definition: to commit a crime or offence
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
police station (abbr. for 警察署[jing3 cha2 shu3])
police department/police station/abbr. of 警察局
